title: George Biagi
text:
George Biagi (born 4 October 1985 in <a href="Irvine%2C%20North%20Ayrshire">Irvine</a>, Scotland) is a retired <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy international</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>. He represented <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a> on 23 occasions. He was born in Scotland to Scots/Italian father and an Italian mother and later went to Italy to study. He has stated he has equal allegiance to both countries.
Biagi started playing rugby at the age of 13 at <a href="Fettes%20College">Fettes College</a>, <a href="Edinburgh">Edinburgh</a>. He attended <a href="Bocconi%20University">Bocconi University</a> in <a href="Milan">Milan</a> and started playing with Grande Milano; the following year he moved to <a href="Amatori%20Milano">Amatori Milano</a>. He was signed by <a href="Rugby%20Club%20I%20Cavalieri%20Prato">Cavalieri Prato</a> with whom he got promoted to Super 10 (now <a href="Top12">Top12</a>) and qualified for the European <a href="Amlin%20Challenge%20Cup">Amlin Challenge Cup</a>. He subsequently transferred to <a href="Aironi">Aironi</a> where he played since the 2010/2011 season, in the <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a> and the <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a>. In June 2012 he signed for <a href="Bristol%20Rugby">Bristol Rugby</a> but in the summer of 2013, Biagi returned to Italy to join the new franchise <a href="Zebre">Zebre</a> in the <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a>. He played for <a href="Zebre">Zebre</a> until <a href="2019-20%20Pro14">2019-20 Pro14</a> season.
